A4.text: Central America is usually defined as consisting of seven countries: Belize, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama.

A5.text: In 1838, Costa Rica, Guatemala, Honduras, and Nicaragua became the first of Central America's seven states to become independent countries.

A6.text: Belize is a country on the north-eastern coast of Central America.

A7.text: It shares a border on the north with the Mexican state of Quintana Roo, on the west with the Guatemalan department of Pet√©n, and on the south with the Guatemalan department of Izabal.
